data.title: A Must in Bakerfield
data.text:
We love the Alley Cat. It is a local dive bar and so much fun. The bartenders are great and the locals super friendly.
It is in an alley and has this super cool Cat in neon. You walk in and there is a pool table, a juke box, a bar, booths and fun.
Everyone is nice and it  is just really an old school bar that you will not easily fine elsewhere. 
I bet Buck Owens was there once (may he rest in peace).
Go there. Have a drink or a soda. Enjoy.

data.title: great dive bar
data.text: wandering around the area, waiting for dinner, so we popped into here for a drink.  Definitely a dive bar with pool table.  Crowd was a mixture of young and old, and you knew it was a neighborhood type bar.  I'd stop here again, if I was in the area, but I live 50 miles away.

data.title: One of the best Dive Bars Downtown
data.text: One of the best Dive Bars Downtown, Full bar, always music playing, Pool Tables, Dart boards and lots of friendly people. The Drinks are very reasonable and Stiff.

data.title: Kickback Dive Bar With A Crazy-Eyed Neon Alley Cat
data.text: Guthrie's Alley Cat is a dive bar supreme, love that you can't see it from the main street. It's literally in an alley. Here everyone's welcome, young and old, crabby and crazy, tatts and trucker hats...and with Bubba, Drew & Ryan at the helm, the Alley Cat's easily one of the friendliest spots around. Started back in the 1940s (originally Oscar's Alley Cat) by GIs returning to Bako after World War II. Super divey, super dark, super strong (try a Kamikaze or Alabama Slammer), loud music, pool, lots of laughing, jukebox...who could ask for anything more? Well, stepping up their restrooms wouldn't hurt. And even tho' they don't serve food, you can buy food next door and bring it back in.

data.title: Classic Dive Bar
data.text: This has been my go to bar for since I was sneaking in through the side door at age 18. A watering hole for a suprising number of screen stars and media types. Crowded, noisy, terrible restrooms, a sometimes rough crowd. It's great and I love it.

data.title: Funky,fun experience
data.text:
Walk to this dive bar from the Padre, people watch, feel comfortable among all ages, all types. Right next door to Mama Roombas and Muertos, both  just reviewed on Diners,Drive ins and Dives. Fun little area to cruise.  Bartenders are fast, drinks are good, just walking and watching is entertaining!  I spent my 50th bday down that area!  Just part of a fun night!
They don't serve food here at the cat itself, strictly an old classic dive bar.

data.title: Oldest bar in Bakersfield
data.text: This is a cool place located in a downtown alley with a fashionable historical neon sign. It's between a couple of restaurants. Good bar selection friendly people. They have a pool table it's not a really big place, but the pool area stretches it out.

data.title: I met my future husband almost 20 years ago here!
data.text: The Alley Cat is a place of honor in Bakersfield to learn how to "Dive Bar" I did meet my future husband outside of the Alley Cat on New Year's 1997 when we were outside ordering Wing Wah Chinese Food for those of us old enough to remember it.  As a female I feel honored to have been tossed out of The Cat for being too rowdy... and that's saying something.   Ahh the memories of a well spent youth.

data.title: Honey..this ain't the Ritz..its a dive bar with history and a neon cat out front...what more can you ask for?
data.text:
When I say dive bar its not a slam, its a badge of honor. Go for the people watching and the cheap drinks. Tattooed hipsters, oil field workers, drunk "regulars", 21st birthday party groups
(there is always a girl with a tiara), well dressed couples that wandered down from the Padre. Its a pot pourri of people that some how works. The wallpaper is flocked, the caricature under the plexi glass on the wall is an Al Hirschfield which in only o1 of 6 in existence and the drinks are poured with a loose hand. Go...its beats staying home and watching reruns of Sons of Anarchy.

data.title: Nice place to have drinks
data.text: Alley Cat's is a nice place to have drinks in Downtown. The owner and managers are really cool people, it is a known destination now for a long time for people in Downtown. They have a pool table and good music.

data.title: Alley Cat Amazing 1940's Bar Is Alive & Kicking!
data.text: The Alley Cat is integral to Bakersfield and America, Set up in the 1940's by brothers returning from WWII the two men set up this iconic American Bar, not overly large the Cat on the Neon Sign says it all, reminisce America. Surviving the 1954 Bakersfield earthquake this bar has seen the likes of actors, singers and entertainers looking for a watering hole, Not over large in size the original bar sports just one pool table but a great bar with their own amazing concoction of the Alabama Slammer. Want a night out that's different where everyone goes and age is no barrier? Attend Guthrie's Alley Cat you might be sitting next to a spritely 96 year old he's attended this bar since 1948!

data.title: Sad to see it age
data.text: We stopped by on a Saturday night with our out of town guests and was disappointed to see how much the bar has aged. It's been 5 years since I was there last and the bar has not changed. As we walked in to the Alley Cat there was a girl trying to get up off the floor only to be hindered by the bar stools and the bar. The bar was filled with smoke because the area where the smokers were smoking was just outside the side door and the smoke from them was filling the bar.

data.title: Calme en semaine
data.text:
Nous sommes allés terminer la soirée un lundi soir dans ce bar, il était presque vide. Donc nous n'avons pas vu l'ambiance qui doit y régner normalement.
Le barman est très pro, il a de bons conseils. Et se soucie si nous apprécions ses cocktails. 
Bonne sélection de bières, taquila et whisky.
